channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024010439
item.description:
Report E-2024010439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 17, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of lactic acid was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the lactic acid- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. Crews transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote to a new one. The damaged tote and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and R+L personnel took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2024010352
item.description:
Report E-2024010352

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: YEMASSEE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 12, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2735 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that R+L had already overpacked the leaking pail, placed absorbents to the spill location. FCE personnel deployed a PH test to the unattended for areas reading a 12. The onsite supervisor informed FCE that no further action would be needed and R+L would finish cleaning the spill in the future.

item.title: Report E-2024010341
item.description:
Report E-2024010341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: WELLFORD
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Xylene (UN1170) was released from four 1-gallon plastic jugs due to a forklift accident when the containers fell off the pallet. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 7. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, the SDS indicated there was a respiratory hazard that required a respirator for clean-up and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 15 gallon DM contains four 1-gallon plastic ugs of Xylene and oil dri was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.
